pull.title: fuzz: add target for local address stuff
pull.body: This PR adds fuzz target for local address functions - (`AddLocal`, `RemoveLocal`, `SeenLocal`, `IsLocal`)

events.message: fuzz: add target for local addresses

events.body:
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
🐙 This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

comments.body: This harness will be non-deterministic and run out of memory since local addresses are stored in a global map. You'll need to reset [`mapLocalHost`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/ba907f96ad37c09c49c0e1532fad118fcb8dd4a8/src/net.cpp#L118) each iteration.
How about adding coverage for `GetLocal` as well?
Probably better to not consume a whole `CNode` each time, maybe do what you did with the service.
Even not being able to overload, sgtm to not consume each time, addressing it.

Maybe use `LOCAL_MAX` here instead of hardcoding `5`:

```suggestion
                const bool added{AddLocal(service, fuzzed_data_provider.ConsumeIntegralInRange<int>(0, LOCAL_MAX - 1))};
```
